org.rdkit.knime.util

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class contains convenience methods to work with file data.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getContentFromResource

        public static java.lang.String getContentFromResource(java.lang.Object caller,
                                                      java.lang.String strResourceName)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in the specified resource text file and returns it as string.
        Parameters:
        caller - The caller of this method. The resource will be inquired based on the class of the caller. Can be null to use FileUtils class instead.
        urlResource - Resource to read. Behind it must be a text file for valid results. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Read string from resource file or passed in value, if not a resource file pointer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getContentFromResource

        public static java.lang.String getContentFromResource(java.net.URL urlResource)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in the specified resource text file and returns it as string.
        Parameters:
        urlResource - Resource to read. Behind it must be a text file for valid results. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        File/resource content.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the file could not be read or if null was passed in.

      • getContentFromResource

        public static java.lang.String getContentFromResource(java.io.InputStream input)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in the specified text from the specified input stream and returns it as string. The input stream gets closed at the end.
        Parameters:
        input - Input stream to read. Behind it must be a text file for valid results. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        Content as string.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the input stream could not be read or if null was passed in.

      • prepareDirectory

        public static void prepareDirectory(java.io.File dir)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to create the specified directory, if it does not exist yet.
        Parameters:
        dir - Directory to be created.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the directory does not exist and could not be created.

      • convertToFile

        public static java.io.File convertToFile(java.lang.String fileUrlOrPath,
                                         boolean bCheckReadAccess,
                                         boolean bCheckWriteAccess)
                                  throws InvalidSettingsException
        This method tries to convert the specified string into a File object. The string may contain a file: URL or a pathname. It is trimmed before the conversion.
        Parameters:
        fileUrlOrPath - The file path or a file: URL. Can be null or empty. In that case an InvalidSettingsException gets thrown.
        Returns:
        File The converted File object, if successful. Never null.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the specified file name could not be converted.

      • close

        public static void close(java.io.InputStream in)
        Convenience method to close an input stream without throwing any exceptions.
        Parameters:
        in - Input stream. Can be null.

      • close

        public static void close(java.io.Reader in)
        Convenience method to close a reader resource without throwing any exceptions.
        Parameters:
        in - Reader resource. Can be null.

      • close

        public static void close(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Convenience method to close an output stream without throwing any exceptions.
        Parameters:
        out - Output stream. Can be null.

      • close

        public static void close(java.io.Writer out)
        Convenience method to close a writer resource without throwing any exceptions.
        Parameters:
        out - Writer resource. Can be null.
